root.TEXT:
Record date: 2059-08-09
EDVISIT^43471375^KIMBROUGH, AMELIA^08/09/59^STEELE, SHAYLYN
This patient was seen with resident, Dr. Penn, whose note was
reviewed and confirmed by me.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: This is a 46-year-old woman with
end-stage renal disease secondary to minimal chain disease, on
hemodialysis, presenting with severe hypertension, headache,
nausea, and vomiting in the setting of blood pressures in the
200s/100s today.
Please review resident's note for full details of past medical
history, social history, review of systems, medications, and
allergies.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: I confirm the physical exam is as
documented. The patient is awake, alert, and appears to be in
mild to moderate discomfort. Vital signs reveal pulse of 108,
respirations 22, blood pressure 226/129, and oximetry is 96% on
room air. The patient is afebrile. HEENT exam reveals well
visualized disks bilaterally on funduscopic exam. There is no
papilledema noted. Posterior pharynx is clear. Lungs are clear
to auscultation with good air movement throughout. Heart is
regular. Abdomen is soft. Extremity exam reveals no cyanosis,
clubbing, or edema. Neurologic: The patient is intact. There
is a left brachiocephalic shunt noted with a good thrill easily
palpable.
LABORATORY DATA: White count is 5.4, hematocrit 45, BUN and
creatinine 31 and 6.0, potassium is noted at 5.3%, cardiac
enzymes flat, and coags are unremarkable.
IMAGING STUDIES: EKG is sinus rhythm without any ST or T-wave
changes concerning for ischemia. Head CT shows no acute
processes.
EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT COURSE: The patient was given IV fluids and
treated with Zofran for her nausea, labetalol 200 mg p.o.
followed by 10 mg intravenously, which brought her pressure down
very nicely to 168/86. After fluids, Zofran, and blood pressure
control, her symptoms improved dramatically. She was admitted to
the Observation Unit to monitor her blood pressure overnight with
anticipated discharge in the morning.
******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
DIAGNOSIS: Hypertensive urgency.
______________________________
STEELE, SHAYLYN
D: 08/12/59
T: 08/12/59
Dictated By: STEELE, SHAYLYN
eScription document:2-5546221 BFFocus
